website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive, entry-level French press that suits most occasional coffee drinkers' needs.
pros: Plastic framework protects fragile glass carafe
cons: Some incidents of rust after a few washings

customer_reviews.title: Stem Filter FAILURE
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even used this product for 2 weeks, and the stem filter attachment came apart this morning! VERY disappointed! No way to use this product now, unless I happen to have some sort of non-toxic waterproof/heatproof glue - which I dont - to put it back together. Waste of money and time, should have known for the low price, you get what you pay for! NOT worth being Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.author: C W

customer_reviews.title: While the other parts work very well, the carafe ...
customer_reviews.text: While the other parts work very well, the carafe itself is poorly made. The bottom broke on mine after using maybe a dozen times and always with very careful use and cleaning. The glass in the bottom of the carafe is extremely thin and will not stand up to even the most careful cleaning. I am abandoning the french press method as too expensive. It simply makes no sense that beakers cannot be made to withstand gentle and proper care.
customer_reviews.author: Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was a good item as the water could be microwaved in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This press caught my eye as there was no metal in the craft/handle and the water could be microwaved before adding the coffee and pressing. It worked like a chap for about a week then the circular mesh/plunger part came off and will not go back on. You get what you pay for, great concept but spend more money to get better quality if you are going to press your coffee. I picked up an old-school, stove top, perk pot ( Set it up the night before, turn it on as you get into the shower and by the time you get out it is one strong cup of Joe.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Bare

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice, low cost press
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, low cost press. I actually use it as a milk frother (with the appropriate plunger) but found that the plastic holder is WAY too tight to easily remove the carafe for cleaning purposes. This is actually my second Tempo press - the first one shattered in my hand as I was trying to put the glass carafe back into the plastic holder which is much, much too tight. On this second item I made a single cut in the upper horizontal plastic frame immediately above the X cross brace. The carafe is still held securely but is now easy to remove and replace.
customer_reviews.author: Phil O

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for more than 2 cuppas
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy and does the job, but I realized I only drink one or two cups of coffee and this product is too big for that. I always end up only using half of the container (filling it halfway). And when I add 2-3 scoops of coffee grounds, and push the press down, the filter isn’t able to squeeze the grounds completely. The grounds just swish around at the bottom every time I pour my coffee. It still filters the grounds fairly well, I just realize that I should have gotten a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made junk
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the design and size but it turned out that the quality of the glass caraffe is poor and weak. I washed it by hand after each use, handled it carefully and kept it from coming into contact with dishes etc. in the sink or drainboard. Still, after less than 2 months, the cheaply made glass developed a crack from the top edge— too late to return or exchange = money down the toilet. Spend your money on a higher quality brand!
customer_reviews.author: mama bird

customer_reviews.title: 100% favorite press I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: I love French Press. This press has made it simple and easy to make. Easy to clean, simple design, and functions incredibly well for the price
customer_reviews.author: That Family

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good value for the price, Not the nicest but if you just want something for yourself that's a good value and inexpensive, and not fancy, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this french press. Followed all the directions and still came out gritty and unflavored. I still cannot get the grits out of the bottom screen pump.
customer_reviews.author: d.sonnier

customer_reviews.title: Not the best size
customer_reviews.text: I dinged it on flavor because it really only makes 1 1/2 mugs full so the 1/2 mug gets too strong or you pour it into a mug then it gets cold.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Malone

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1.5 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second press I ordered from this maker. The first one lasted a year, then broke at attachment point where the 'press-down filter' connects to the stem. The second one I just got 1.5 months ago and has broken in the same way. I am going to return it and won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is okay for a first press, a temporary press, or a press used very little. I happen to use mine every day and will definitely be upgrading. My GSI backpacking press is higher quality than this. This has been durable, but the only issue is the quality of the plunger. It's loose, does not provide enough pressure, the lid rattles a bit. You can expect this quality for the price; I just needed a temporary replacement for a good one. It makes my coffee every morning, and I still prefer this to a drip pot any day, but if you can invest in something nicer with higher quality DO IT.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: I got another one that I was VERY disappointed with but will be returning that one and ordering ...
customer_reviews.text: This little french press does just what it is suppose to do. I got another one that I was VERY disappointed with but will be returning that one and ordering one of these for myself. (I'd borrowed this one from a friend) The coffee in it was very good!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Logan

customer_reviews.title: Lid needs a better fit to provide more pressure
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a decent French press. My coffee has a nice aromatic taste and it is easy to clean and use. Plunger really doesn't provide enough pressure and I know my coffee could be a little better tasting.
customer_reviews.author: mogo88

customer_reviews.title: Glass breaks, who knew?
customer_reviews.text: This makes about 3 small cups of coffee. It’s easy to use and clean. I’ve had two and one broke after falling off the counter and one chipped seemingly unprovoked. But glass is the best option. Having a hard time finding a replacement that I like so I might buy this one a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lindner

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my office and its perfect! Makes 2 full cups of coffee/tea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office and its perfect! Makes 2 full cups of coffee/tea. I like the design too. I keep it on my shelf for easy access at work and it is not an eye sore. Very pleased with this. Just follow all the instructions and you shouldn't have any issues. I only wish that this came with a plastic measuring/stir spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: It works great, there’s nothing to complain about
customer_reviews.text: We have one of these that we’ve used for over a year now but I bought another to have at a different location. It works great, there’s nothing to complain about. It’s made well, and the screen doesn’t allow coffee through. It easily makes enough coffee for two standard mugs with a little left over. Also, you can take the mesh filter and metal pice at the bottom apart to wash out any stuck grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Shayna

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Being a mom, I use this every single day and it works perfect. It makes about two large cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Vasbinder

customer_reviews.title: Was great, till it broke...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product, until it broke. I only use it on the weekends when I’m home, and this weekend it just broke. I was just rinsing it out and the top/screen part just came undone and won’t do back together. I tried twisting it, pushing it and nothing has worked. Completely disappointed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Sauly

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Press at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple weeks now and use it daily. For this price, this is a great little coffee press. I did not have high expectations since I also have a Bodum, but this little guy is just as good and for a tiny fraction of the cost. It makes two large mugs of coffee (three regular mugs) and is sturdy. Honestly, you cannot beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Careful of the glass
customer_reviews.text: Works great for french press coffee. Use a wooden spoon or spatula as a metal spoon will crack the glass.
customer_reviews.author: spunrubbermat

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves his french press to make coffee. ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his french press to make coffee. He even is using it in a youtube video we made together on my account (thejusticepirate on youtube). Therefore you can see it used in action. I wouldn't say this is a 6 cup though unless they are measuring cups. He gets about two and a half cups of coffee from it.
customer_reviews.author: Justicepirate

customer_reviews.title: Good for price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I like it. The price is right and it has a quality heft to it. Sooner or later, I break the glass on containers like this. I go through about 1 a year, and I use it 2-3 times a day. Note...this one doesn't not have a comb-like filter on the front...so you could be getting more grounds than you are used to in your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Ed's Eco Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Good Coffee... who says you need an expensive piece of equipment to press coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got some beans and tried this little press. I was hoping it would work and a little worried since it was fairly cheap to buy. It actually works quite well!!! I even microwaved water right in the carafe (no lid of course since there is metal on that part of the press. good strong coffee
customer_reviews.author: *BSSD*

customer_reviews.title: It's super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is saving me every day. It's super easy to use, once you look up instructions online. The grate thing is a little difficult to clean, as coffee grounds get stuck underneath it. Also, watch out for the glass part slipping out of the nice red plastic part. This happened while I was cleaning it one day and the glass almost shattered.
customer_reviews.author: Broke College Student

customer_reviews.title: A great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: A great french press! Ours lasted a year, and then I knocked it over (my bad) so we immediately purchased another one! Easy to clean, and the bottom parts (the mesh and such that filters it out) can all be taken apart to be washed thoroughly when cleaning! And you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: ali a.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The press doesn’t go all the way down, leaving about 3/4” on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: LD2Comp

customer_reviews.title: I hated how coffee tasted out of my keurig
customer_reviews.text: This has been a god send. I hated how coffee tasted out of my keurig. It had such a chemical taste. I honestly thought I'd hate having to allow extra time for this, but the coffee is so much better, it's absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: Good buy coffee press!
customer_reviews.text: Decent coffee press, hopefully the screen and other components don’t fail on me or break off like my other one. I’m considering this a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P.

customer_reviews.title: Still going and no grinds
customer_reviews.text: The glass hasn't broken since I purchased it in Jan 2015. I really like this coffee press. I also like that there are no grind when pouring in my mug..definitely a plus. Update: 3/16/2015 Just like onee of the reviewer mentioned, the mesh dislodged from the shaft. Anyone know how to fix this?
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my first French Press and I love it. It works perfectly and was easy to figure out how to work. Easy to clean, simply rinse after each use. Dishwasher safe on top rack only. The only downside is I wish the water stayed hot while brewing as I must reheat beverage after brewing process is completed.
customer_reviews.author: Koketta

customer_reviews.title: french press
customer_reviews.text: screen is a little fragile and has shredded a little BUT the grounds to not bled through yet
customer_reviews.author: 92plus

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to hold and easy to wash
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact size I was looking for and the with the removable plastic frame. No getting burned hands while handling.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Bargain price, nice design/ quality
customer_reviews.text: I've used it twice in one day. Nice design, the plastic surround keeps the hot hot glass from touching the counter or table, plunger design is good. Cleans up easily with one of those happy face sponges, soap and water. For the price... Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: It's a good/simple looking press. It worked ok for ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good/simple looking press. It worked ok for about one month. I used it about every other day and handwashed it gently each time. But after that, the mesh strainer part started to weaken. The press part would not sit at the top and would prematurely sink into the glass before the coffee was completely brewed. The mesh wasn't a strong barrier, and the coffee grounds would end up in my cup. I checked to to see if everything was screwed ok and it was. Gave it a few more tries and had to throw out a few cups of coffee due to coffee grounds. I ended up throwing this product away after one month use.
customer_reviews.author: janek

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, I use it every morning! There is no better way to drink coffee in my opinion. My boyfriend and I also own a coffee grinder, so this french press provides us with the perfect wake-me-up routine with that amazing freshly ground coffee smell. It is perfect for two cups of coffee, and you have a little extra if you need a small refill. It doesn't leave any gross coffee grounds in your cup either, I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing press for $10
customer_reviews.text: Amazing press for $10! My 2nd one because I dropped my 1st glass portion. Would absolutely buy for any/everyone that needed a press. Equal quality to a $35-45 one from B.B.Bey.or W.Mkt. Grwat product with few parts to have anything go wrong with!:)
customer_reviews.author: Jill O.

customer_reviews.title: Love our new coffee press
customer_reviews.text: Love our new coffee press! Sure makes better coffee than a regular coffee pot!!! Easy to use and to clean.Highly recomended!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The holder on top is plastic and got broken after few use
customer_reviews.text: The holder on top is plastic and got broken after few use
customer_reviews.author: Alper T. Turker

customer_reviews.title: My favorite french press
customer_reviews.text: My favorite french press! The glass is held very well inside the plastic wrap and does not come loose- I've broken other ones that aren't held so sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Press isn’t as tight as pricier alternative products, but an excellent value and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: yesler!

customer_reviews.title: Changed the way I drink coffee
customer_reviews.text: Had to watch some videos on YouTube to make sure I used it right and I brewed my first cups right away. Didn't know the coffee I bought at the store could taste so good. They say it's better with fresh ground, but I don't have a grinder....yet.
customer_reviews.author: ARNGbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps temperature for a decent amount of time. Works ...
customer_reviews.text: Keeps temperature for a decent amount of time. Works well and is light. Does have a few scratches on the inside form use but not enough to cosmetically change the appearance of the item.
customer_reviews.author: RRRR

customer_reviews.title: Thin and fragile
customer_reviews.text: Very thin glass. It was in fact so thin it did not survive the shipping and arrived as a box full of broken glass and a separate plastic holder so I have no idea how coffee made in this may taste..
customer_reviews.author: BoMarc

customer_reviews.title: Solid, does the job it’s meant to do
customer_reviews.text: The one issue is that the filter piece that you push down, sometimes loosens and unscrews, kinda a nuisance, just have to check and occasionally tighten Still a solid product
customer_reviews.author: Jonna Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Press!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my "camping coffee press" due to the price but i've been using everyday at home. Does a great job of pressing the coffee grinds, and makes one hell of a cup of joe!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: which I like. No problems
customer_reviews.text: Glass is slightly thicker than normal for french presses, which I like. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked decently at first, but the filter and connector piece broke. Not sturdy at all, it's definitely worth paying a bit more to get a better model that will last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mcbee

customer_reviews.title: This is a good press for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is a good press for the buck. It isn't anything special.. but it does exactly what a French press should. So, for the money why buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Fits me

customer_reviews.title: Well, the old saying goes... you ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, the old saying goes... you get what you pay for. Used less than a week and the plunger is already broken. This product is not worthy of Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Pouring coffee
customer_reviews.text: This French press is easy enough to use. The spout doesn't seem to direct the coffee when pouring compared to the previous French press I had.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne Barrett

customer_reviews.title: useful and better tasting than regular drip or even Keurig
customer_reviews.text: useful and better tasting than regular drip or even Keurig. I enjoy a stout coffee and just a few cups. perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Expect a filthy uncleaned item with coffee grounds
customer_reviews.text: This is clearly a used item. It was in a sealed box but inside was a filthy product with water stains and still had quite a few coffee grounds in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: 1st one I bought was great but this one I received not so much
customer_reviews.text: 1st one I bought was great but this one I received not so much. The glass is not glued/properly secured in the plastic frame so it starts to slide out when pouring coffee. Need to hold the glass to keep it in place. Probably a manufacturing defect. But the other one I have is lovely. Just disappointed this one is not to par.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: It's OK but the plunger was always coming unscrewed. ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but the plunger was always coming unscrewed. The spout chipped off with normal washing then kept chipping finally had to through out. Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy O

customer_reviews.title: for fear I will never get it to go back together like it should
customer_reviews.text: Do not order - the first one I received became nonfunctional after the second use. The stem inside the lid, where it screws to the filter, stripped out and wouldn't attach firmly anymore. I was sent a replacement, and after a couple of uses, it's trying to do the same thing. I'm just trying to wash it without taking it apart now, for fear I will never get it to go back together like it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gordon

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: I really love my french press. Easy to clean. Easy to make delicious coffee. I highly recommend this product! Rick Rahim
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rahim

customer_reviews.title: Opened on Christmas Morning Dirty/Used
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to see from the picture I took.. But this came filthy. It looked used, which was embarrassing to have someone open as their Christmas gift. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: megan flynn

customer_reviews.title: Used camping and the coffee tasted like from my drip machine
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Used camping and the coffee tasted like from my drip machine. No mess, not much waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My second one.
customer_reviews.text: We had one exactly like this for years and I broke it. Thankful I was able to find an exact replacement. It makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Hearnsberger

customer_reviews.title: I get two full cups of coffee from this beautiful coffee press (I like 8oz cups >
customer_reviews.text: I get two full cups of coffee from this beautiful coffee press (I like 8oz cups >.< ). I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy press for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little French press for the price. Although glass, it's plastic sheath makes it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Makes about 2 regular sized cups of coffee, quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: after it was used I hear he liked it
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift looks large enough to make 3-4 of regular people sized cups. after it was used I hear he liked it
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Siegert

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best quality French presses you can get for the price. Seriously. I've owned a couple over the years and I love this. It is great for coffee and loose leaf tea alike!
customer_reviews.author: Azzy G

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Still using this on almost a daily basis. Love this product. There are times when the components can loosen up, especially after you try to clean in between, but you can always just re-tighten the bar and filter screens.
customer_reviews.author: G. Malvar

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was good while it lasted, but the press broke within a year.
customer_reviews.author: JackieN

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. It was cheaper for me to order ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. It was cheaper for me to order this on Amazon than to go to the store to get it.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It holds about 4 normal cups of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Latisha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great, can even use a 5 cup machine filter over the plunger for finely ground coffee:)
customer_reviews.author: Matt G.

customer_reviews.title: Worst French Press
customer_reviews.text: I never leave reviews but I hate this french press so much that I feel compelled. The spout and pour are awful. More often than not, coffee goes spilling down the sides of the container. I am a 33 year old, fully functioning and very capable adult but yet cannot pour this thing without coffee running down the sides (I'll guess about 75 percent of the time). I usually hold it over the sink when pouring to reduce the necessary clean up. DO NOT BUY THIS THING.
customer_reviews.author: hag666

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this french press because the glass cylinder comes out of the plastic handle
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Filter broke after three days, I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your money!
customer_reviews.text: A very basic french press at a very affordable price. There is not much more to ask for. I like that the plastic surrounds the entire base of the glass so there is less risk of breaking when you set it down on your granite countertops as was the case with my previous french press.
customer_reviews.author: raul gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good product for making a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Dopko

customer_reviews.title: Buy yourself and aeropress you'll be happy
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 weeks. Buy yourself and aeropress you'll be happy
customer_reviews.author: jonah bates

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice quality French press. Great price and shipped fast!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Hentzler

customer_reviews.title: Glass is thin
customer_reviews.text: Glass is a bit thin. I tried tipping the whole thing upside down to push the glass part out of the plastic part for cleaning and my finger went through the glass. Lots of blood all round though I was pressing quite hard.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pogle

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously love this thing!!!! We bought our for our camper and I couldn't be more pleased! No more gritty cowboy coffee for us!
customer_reviews.author: sarahh

customer_reviews.title: makes the best tasting coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: Used for special days, makes the best tasting coffee ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Albert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is my 2nd one, bc I misplaced my original when I moved.
customer_reviews.author: Mily Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait for this item to break so I can replace with a Bodom. This press is cheap quality and impossible to pour without dripping.
customer_reviews.author: Laura V

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but good value
customer_reviews.text: The glass is rather thin, so one must be careful not to shatter this while rinsing or moving the thing. Pretty good value for the price though, looks nice and makes good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: ZTK

customer_reviews.title: Good, fairly inexpensive French Press
customer_reviews.text: Good, fairly inexpensive French Press. Had to replace after 6 ish months because the glass on the bottom broke out, but I did naively use a metal spoon to scrape used grounds out, so it may have been my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Miner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: This Press is terrible. The press has no pressure. The plunger doesn't stay up It just sinks to the bottom no matter what. The filter never goes straight down and is always crooked. The filter doesn't keep grinds down. I wish I kept the box so I could return this awful coffee press. I recommend no one, I repeat No One buy this coffee press!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Holmsen

customer_reviews.title: Great little pot
customer_reviews.text: Great little pot! the price is great and the press works well!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 6 months now and it is still working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This will come in very handy when we have a black out here in NYC. I can boil water and make coffee asap! On the last black out my next door neighbor lent me hers and it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Aviva

customer_reviews.title: Crack before I got it
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box to find a small Crack in the glass
customer_reviews.author: Emery C

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's amazing and makes the coffee taste so good! Definitely recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: It was great for the 3 times I was able to use ...
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the 3 times I was able to use it. The filter part broke during the wash and now its useless. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Its an awesome product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its an awesome product for the price, I honestly wish I had bought the smaller one though bcs I end up misjudging the amounts and make too much coffee. Then of course I have to drink it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: worked for a while, but was cleaning it one ...
customer_reviews.text: worked for a while, but was cleaning it one day and tapped the bottom to get the grounds out, and it shattered
customer_reviews.author: Grace G

customer_reviews.title: False advertising!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is not 6 cups. Not even capable of fitting 4 cups. Would be ok if it didn't claim 6 cups.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: like it better then the all glass ,plastic protects it from dings.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: awesome for making cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: awesome for making cold brew coffee. kind of a pain to put back together once you unscrew its screen part, for cleaning... otherwise totally good.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Scharff

customer_reviews.title: No filters, clean taste
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Hard to drink gas station coffee again after trying a French Press.
customer_reviews.author: PRAM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and painful if you're not paying attention
customer_reviews.text: Spills a lot when pouring into cup. Disappointing and painful if you're not paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahpo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I recommend this product. I like how simple it is to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this camping due to its smaller size. Makes a perfect 2 cups of coffee. I misplaced my first one and ordered another before my last trip.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kelly

product_meta.title: Primula Tempo French Press Premium Filtration with No Grounds, Heat Resistant Borosilicate Glass, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackWith its 6 cup Capacity, sturdily constructed borosilicate glass beaker and stainless steel plunger, the Tempo Coffee press offers dependable and delicious French press Coffee service. French press aficionados prefer this method of brewing because it allows them to customize the Coffee to exactly their desired strength, according to the time it steeps. The expertly crafted plunger and superfine stainless steel mesh filter are what set this French Coffee press part from the ordinary variety. You’ll enjoy the rich, bold flavor of French press Coffee, which brews without the need for paper filters, which saves money and is kind to the environment. This contemporary French press Coffee maker includes the heat resistant and temperature safe glass beaker; stainless steel plunger and filter that reduces grit and sediment; and frame, lid and stay cool handle. The specially designed lid and spout assure clean, even pouring. Easy to use and clean, the BPA free Tempo Coffee press is dishwasher safe, making this a French press Coffee maker you can use and enjoy every day.
feature_bullets: DURABLE CONSTRUCTION- The premium Tempo French press coffee maker is constructed of heat resistant plastic that encases the high quality borosilicate glass carafe. This French press is built for performance for your coffee or tea making needs.
PREMIUM FILTRATION SYSTEM- The fine stainless steel French press coffee plunger filter is perfect for making flavorful coffee without sediment.

FLAVORFUL COFFEE OR TEA- use the Tempo French press to make flavorful coffee or tea. Coffee lovers can add favorite flavors such as vanilla, cinnamon or coconut before cold brewing while tea lovers can add mint or citrus zest.
EASY TO CLEAN- the Tempo French press coffee maker is as easy to clean as it is to use. The Tempo is dishwasher safe for fast and easy clean up.

EASY TO USE- you can make flavorful French press coffee in just 3 simple steps: 1) Remove the French press plunger and add desired amount of coffee grounds. 2) pour hot water and allow coffee to brew to desired strength. 3) serve and enjoy.
MAKES A GREAT GIFT- the Tempo coffee press is great for gift giving for coffee lovers, foodies, tea lovers and more.
